snippet: Rescuers were searching for nearly 300 people, most of them high school students, who remained unaccounted for after a ferry that was carrying them to a resort island sank.
abstract: More than 280 people, many of them high school students, are missing after South Korean ferry carrying them to a resort island capsizes and sinks.

byline.original: By SU-HYUN LEE and CHOE SANG-HUN
byline.contributor: Su-hyun Lee reported from Jindo, and Choe Sang-hun from Seoul, South Korea.

lead_paragraph: Rescuers were searching for nearly 300 people, most of them high school students, who remained unaccounted for after a ferry that was carrying them to a resort island sank.

headline.main: Students Among Hundreds Missing After South Korean Ferry Sinks
headline.print_headline: Students Among Hundreds Missing After South Korean Ferry Sinks
